greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular table read by rows: the n-th row gives all the numbers with the prime signature of n using only prime divisors of n.
comment: If n is a perfect power of a squarefree number then it contributes only one term.
mathematica: a[n_] := Module[{f = FactorInteger[n]}, p = f[[;; , 1]]; e = f[[;; , 2]]; Times @@ Power[p, #] & /@ Permutations[e]]; s = {}; Do[s = Join[s, a[n]], {n, 1, 55}]; s (* _Amiram Eldar_, Jul 20 2019 *)
results.author: _Amarnath Murthy_, Aug 05 2005
